title: 113_s1073
content: The Gas Price and Refinery Capacity Relief Act of 2013, also known as the ``Gas Price and Refinery Capacity Relief Act of 2013'', amends Section 804 of the Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007 to coordinate refinery outages. The Gas Price and Refinery Capacity Relief Act of 2013 defines key terms related to refineries, such as Administrator, planned refinery outage, refined petroleum product, and refinery. The Gas Price and Refinery Capacity Relief Act of 2013 defines terms related to refineries, including unplanned refinery outage as the removal of a refinery or unit from service without prior scheduling. Refinery owners must report planned outage schedules and estimated inventories, as well as any unplanned outages promptly. The Gas Price and Refinery Capacity Relief Act of 2013 requires the Administrator to review and analyze information on planned and unplanned refinery outages to assess their potential impact on the price and supply of refined petroleum products nationally or regionally. The Gas Price and Refinery Capacity Relief Act of 2013 mandates the Administrator to assess refinery outages that could impact petroleum product prices or supply. The Secretary must provide information on planned or unplanned outages to prevent market disruptions, without altering refinery operators' legal obligations or creating new rights of action. The Secretary cannot prohibit planned outages. The Gas Price and Refinery Capacity Relief Act of 2013 mandates the Secretary to study and report on the costs and benefits of creating a national strategic refined petroleum products reserve. The report will include information on existing storage capabilities and the feasibility of increasing storage. The Gas Price and Refinery Capacity Relief Act of 2013 requires the Secretary to study the costs and benefits of establishing a national strategic reserve for refined petroleum products. The study will assess existing storage capabilities, feasibility of increasing storage capacity regionally, and the impact on retail prices in case of supply shortages or market disruptions.
